events.title: A Growing City!
events.description:
Your city is growing quickly, and you're concerned about potential gridlock.
You have some options to address this:

options.title: Mass Transit
options.description: Benefits go beyond emissions reduction! Traffic congestion is reduced, fewer accidents occur, and air quality improves.

options.title: Ridesharing
options.description: Cheap gas and free parking compels people to travel alone. Incentivizing ridesharing may reduce the number of cars on the road.

options.title: Do nothing
options.description: As the city continues to grow, developing transportation infrastructure will become more expensive.

events.title: Cold Weather
events.description:
In the winter, heating is a big source of energy draw. Solutions often increase energy efficiency in both the summer and the winter!
You can take action:

options.title: Insulation
options.description: Incentivizing insulation would prevent unwanted heat loss and gain, both in the winter and the summer!

options.title: District Heating
options.description: District Heating and Cooling (DHC) features a central plant to channel hot and cool water to many buildings. This enables thermal energy to be provided collectively and efficiently!

options.title: Do nothing
options.description: Your emissions from heating cooling will continue to increase as time goes on.
